wikipedia_page.main: Eustace Jotham VC (28 November 1883 – 7 January 1915) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: * Eustace Jotham, served as a captain in the Great War, winning the Victoria Cross in 1915; was born in Kidderminster.

link_mentions.page: List of English Victoria Cross recipients
response: |Eustace Jotham || British Indian Army || 1915 || North-West Frontier Province || Spina

link_mentions.page: Indian Army during World War I
response: *Eustace Jotham, 51st Sikhs attached North Waziristan Militia
It was during these operations when Captain Eustace Jotham was awarded the Victoria Cross.
* Eustace Jotham (1883–1915): soldier, awarded the VC
